page.title: 13 LAW AND ORDER
page.content: A BEAT OFFICER'S JOB A beat officer is assigned to a particular community to establish a relationship with that community.He or she works in the community all the time.They get to know the local people such as shopkeepers in an attempt to make policing more personal.The beat officer we interviewed had many local contacts which he found useful in responding to local anxieties about crime and in detecting local patterns of crime such as increases in drug taking. He works an 8 hour shift which may be split into two 4 hour periods.He arranges these shifts depending on the crime prevalent ,he comes out on the streets when these crimes are likely to be happening.At the moment he is active between 12 noon and 2 pm. when a large number of burglaries take place.
